title: Cancelation of naturalization ceremonies is ‘disturbing to the utmost degree,’ Wu says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Immigrants from certain "high-risk" countries on the verge of gaining their citizenship are being turned away by federal officials.

Boston City Council President Ruthzee Louijeune, Executive Director of Project Citizenship Gail Breslow, and Boston Mayor Michelle Wu hold a press conference in Faneuil Hall to address the cancelation of naturalization ceremonies for some immigrants.
Jonathan Wiggs/Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Cade Cunningham explained why he ‘loves’ competing against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "They’re a championship team; they’ve got a championship identity.
Play a great brand of basketball, so it’s always a test for us coming in.
" Cade Cunningham (AP Photo/Charles Krupa The NBA season is still young, but at this moment it’s the Detroit Pistons who sit atop the Eastern Conference standings with a league-best 21-5 record.

title: After nearly 20 years, Somerville’s abandoned Star Market finally comes down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Residents gathered Saturday to watch the demolition of a long-vacant grocery store, clearing the way for new housing and retail.
A rat is giving the abandoned Star Market in Somerville's Winter Hill neighborhood a fresh coat of paint.
Molly Farrar/Boston.

title: Jaylen Brown on heated exchange, physicality against the Pistons
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "We were just having fun, I think Stewart is a nice guy.
" Jaylen Brown and Isaiah Stewart both received technical fouls following their exchange (Charles Krupa/AP Photo).
The Celtics had their six-game win streak broken on Monday night in a 112-105 loss to the Pistons, but they didn’t go down without a fight, in multiple senses of the word.

title: Julian Edelman’s take on the Patriots’ loss to the Bills, how New England can respond
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "They were undermanned, but so were the Buffalo Bills.
So is everyone else.
" Julian Edelman during his Patriots Hall of Fame induction ceremony at a Patriots game in Sept.

title: Rob Reiner taught me how to see love as comedy
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Reiner, a legendary filmmaker, died on Sunday.
His romance films suggest that love may be inherently funny.
Writer-director Rob Reiner poses for a portrait, May 2, 2016, in New York.

title: Roomies were dealing meth out of their Brighton apartment, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Both roommates have prior criminal records dating back to the '90s, according to the district attorney.
Two Brighton roommates were charged on Thursday with dealing meth out of their apartment, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.
Vincenzo Porfino, 43, pleaded not guilty to trafficking methamphetamine of less than 100 grams.

title: Mass. man who allegedly threatened co-workers arrested with gun, drugs
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Dwayne Richardson has a criminal record for violent and drug-related crimes dating back to 1992.
A West Bridgewater man was arrested last week after allegedly brandishing a gun to his co-workers and threatening to kill them, the Suffolk County District Attorney announced Monday.
